answer:
Isogonic lines on a sectional chart are a depiction of lines on the surface of the earth along which magnetic declination is equal, in units of 1 degree, east or west from true north. Magnetic declination (or variation) is a measure, along the horizontal plane, of the angular difference between magnetic north and true north.

(Pilotâ€™s Handbook of Aeronautical Knowledge 16-6, FAA Sectional Chart legends)
question: What do the isogonic lines on a sectional chart indicate?
